summary: The document is a memorandum from the Chief of the Alien Affairs Staff, dated 5 April 1968, regarding Miguel Angel DIAZ Isalgué, a Cuban parolee born on 14 February 1937, in Matanzas, Cuba. It outlines the arrangements for his temporary duty travel to Argentina under an alias, including the preparation of an Argentine passport with a B-2 visa and an I-512 Reentry Document to ensure his travel in South America and reentry as a parolee. This memorandum is part of the records associated with the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
key_findings: Miguel Angel DIAZ Isalgué was a paroled Cuban born on 14 February 1937, in Matanzas, Cuba.
He was scheduled for temporary duty travel to Argentina under an alias.
Documents including an Argentine passport with a B-2 visa and an I-512 Reentry Document were prepared for his travel and reentry.
The memorandum is part of the records related to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
